channel.title: New Prim sword (unamed)
channel.description: Well for the past week i have been getting myself fimiliar with prim and how i can manipulate them so i finished a sword that took me roughly 10 minutes to make but i would apreciate comments and constructive criticism but if you are going to flame me then do not bother posting ...and if enough people coment good about it i will release =)

item.title: New Prim sword (unamed)
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:8, topic:357965”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=454480.msg3328741#msg3328741 date=1283297190]

Second time you’ve said that now. Get your eye fixed bro.
[/quote]
You know he’s like blind right? Or is that why your saying that?[/quote]

Yea Yea I know the story. It was in my topic lol

Read full topic

item.title: New Prim sword (unamed)
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:5, topic:357965”]Not bad for starting out doing primitives (i think?), although here is a bit of CC/Tips:

Use a cube for the blade, not a cylinder (blades are not round?)
I would say the blade needs an edge, except that you used a Cylinder so its a bit harder.
A bit less poly on the blade coulda been done there[/quote]

Second time you’ve said that now. Get your eye fixed bro.

Read full topic

item.title: New Prim sword (unamed)
item.dc:creator: @kirikugi kirikugi
item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

uhh no i used a cube and a cylinder for the hilt

Read full topic

item.title: New Prim sword (unamed)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Not bad for starting out doing primitives (i think?), although here is a bit of CC/Tips:

Use a cube for the blade, not a cylinder (blades are not round?)
I would say the blade needs an edge, except that you used a Cylinder so its a bit harder.
A bit less poly on the blade coulda been done there

Read full topic
